archetype_name: Family Low-Sodium American & French Comfort (30–60, Mild)
name: Creamy Dijon-Mushroom Beef over Fettuccine with Roasted Lemon Green Beans
description: A bistro-style, low-sodium skillet beef and mushroom cream sauce served over fettuccine, with bright roasted lemon green beans. Mild flavors and weeknight-friendly steps.
prep_steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil for the pasta (no added salt).
Trim green beans and pat dry.
Thinly slice onion; clean and slice mushrooms.
Zest the lemon, then cut it into wedges.
Thinly slice the beef across the grain.
cook_steps: Roast the beans: On a sheet pan, toss green beans with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of black pepper, and half the lemon zest. Spread out and roast 12–15 minutes until tender with lightly browned spots. Squeeze 1–2 lemon wedges over before serving.
Cook pasta: Add fettuccine to boiling water and cook until al dente per package time. Reserve 1/2 cup cooking water, then drain.
Sear beef: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a large skillet over medium-high. Add beef in a single layer; sear 1–2 minutes per side until just browned. Transfer to a plate.

Sauté veg: Reduce heat to medium. Add remaining 1 tbsp olive oil and the onion; cook 2 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook 5–6 minutes until they release moisture and brown. Stir in garlic for 30 seconds.
Make roux: Add remaining 1 tbsp butter and sprinkle in flour. Stir 1 minute to coat.
Deglaze and simmer: Pour in white wine, scraping up browned bits. Add mushroom stock and remaining lemon zest; simmer 3–4 minutes until slightly thickened.
Finish sauce: Stir in mustard and creme fraiche. Return beef and any juices to the pan; simmer 1–2 minutes until just cooked through. Season with black pepper and a squeeze of lemon to taste.

Serve: Toss drained fettuccine with a splash of reserved pasta water and a ladle of sauce, or plate pasta and spoon beef-mushroom sauce over the top. Garnish with parsley. Serve with roasted lemon green beans.
